Create Indigenous Managed Lands Raster (LANDMark + ICCA)

make_indigenous_managed_lands.Rd

This function identifies Indigenous- and community-managed lands using two datasets: the LANDMark dataset and the ICCA Registry. It buffers point geometries (if required), combines them, calculates their fractional coverage over a planning unit raster, applies a threshold, and returns a binary raster indicating likely Indigenous management presence.

Usage

make_indigenous_managed_lands(
  sf_landmark = NULL,
  sf_icca = NULL,
  iso3,
  pus,
  buffer_points = TRUE,
  output_path = NULL
)

Arguments

sf_landmark

sf or NULL. Indigenous and community lands from the LANDMark dataset. Must be subset to the target country.

sf_icca

sf or NULL. ICCA Registry features. Must be subset to the target country.

iso3

Character. ISO3 country code used for output naming.

pus

SpatRaster. Raster of planning units for alignment and coverage calculations.

buffer_points

Logical. Whether to buffer POINT/MULTIPOINT geometries to create polygon representations. Default is TRUE.

output_path

Character or NULL. Directory to save the final raster as a Cloud Optimized GeoTIFF (COG). If NULL, the file is not written to disk.

Value

A binary SpatRaster where:

  • 1 = area is considered Indigenous-managed (based on coverage)

  • 0 = area is not Indigenous-managed

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
indigenous_lands <- make_indigenous_managed_lands(
  sf_landmark = landmark_sf,
  sf_icca = icca_sf,
  iso3 = "COL",
  pus = planning_units,
  output_path = "outputs/"
)
terra::plot(indigenous_lands)
} # }
